reviews.review:
The cake is a lie!
Dieses Spiel ist ienfach Top und auch wenn es so alt ist macht es immer noch eine Menge Spaß und ich denke jeder sollte es für daskleine Geld wenigstens mal ausprobieren, ebenfalls Portal 2

miss you companion Cube :(
Eyy that's moderately mediocre. It's pretty good but it's short
很好玩的游戏，关卡设计很富有创造力与想象力，高级实验好难。

クリア(ボーナスステージ等を除く)まで4時間程度の分量でした。

ポータルガンを使った爽快な謎解きアクション、[strike]キャラ(試験官？)[/strike]GLaDOSちゃんの性格などなど魅力的な要素がたくさんあるゲームです。
個人的にエンディング曲がすごい好きでした。

謎解きに関しては、アクションが絡んでいるので、戦闘不能になる可能性のあるステージも多々あります。
しかし、死んでもコンティニューポイントもすぐ近くにあるし、クイックセーブもあるので、色々と解法を試してみるのがいいと思います。

ヒントがピクトグラムなので、その意味が分からないと解法が中々分からなかったりするのがちょっとなとは思いました。
[strike]まあ文字がない方が雰囲気はいいんですけどね。[/strike]

セールでとても安く手に入れられるし、気になってる方は買って損がないゲームです！


16.12.04追記：
*コンピュータの名前はGLaDOSって言うんですね。
*一部誤字を修正しました。
Интересная игра, единственная в своем роде
Отличная игра! Играть всем)

O jogo em si é sensacional, a ideia dos portais me surpreendeu muito depois que joguei, e somente depois que joguei. Esse é o tipo de jogo que nos faz pensar em como alguém não pensou nisso antes? Ou, por que não joguei isso antes?
Coloco como únicos pontos negativos a facilidade (relativo) e o tamanho da campanha (curta).

Ein schlicht weg Geniales Spiel.
Alles passt.
Spielt sich aus heutiger sicht immer noch genau so gt wie früher.
Ein must have.
Excellent game, brilliant dry humour and Glados deserves to win the Villian most in need of a hug ;-)

Hoje vejo Portal como um clássico, com easter eggs por todo lado e bastante famoso. É comum ver bolos que são mentira por ai. Desta forma, o Portal 2 se tornou um jogo mais conhecido, talvez pela jogabilidade refinada em relação ao anterior e sendo mais linear ao invés de só com vários puzzles. Ainda assim, o jogo que possui a ideia inicial nunca deixa de ser um clássico.

Помню как гонялся за The Orange Box, в комлект которого входила эта игрушка. Какие-то дебилоиды-манагеры из Буки решили продавать Orange Box первый месяц только в магазинах Эльдорадо. За пару дней объехал пол-города, с предсказуемым итогом - тупо нигде не было. Затем дебилоиды-манагеры из Эльдорадо додумались приматывать к диску какую-нить фигню типа салфеток в банках. Натурально приматывали! Скотчем! (не забесплатно канеш).

В итоге пришлось забить на этот цирк и взять через пару недель уже в нормальном магазе.

Ну и Portal стала натуральным открытием. Её никто не ждал. Почти никто про неё не знал. Все ждали Второй Эпизод Халфы и ТФ2. А тут такой сюрприз в комплекте!

На редкость приятный и неожиданный сюрприз.

！！【忠告：这游戏慎买】！！
特码的破游戏！！
转的老子晚饭差点吐出来！！
墙裂不推荐！！！太坑爹了！！！
我玩不下去了！！！！头晕！！！！！
Un juego tremendamente disfrutable, los puzzles son sencillos y su historia entretenida, muy divertida y tremendamente sorprendente
Ziemlich cooles Spiel!

Jogo genial, apresenta uma ótima jogabilidade, te faz raciocinar do inicio ao fim em todas as tarefas que devem ser realizadas. O jogo foi muito bem planejado, apresenta uma trama envolvente com um vilão marcante. A atmosfera claustrofóbica e perturbadora, por mais sutil que seja, fará você se sentir ameaçado, sendo que nem inimigos há no jogo. Pode ser curto, mas é um dos mais imersivos e intrigantes jogos já lançados, cuja experiência proporcionada será lembrada por muito tempo.
经典

클리어 했습니다. 한 3-4시간쯤 걸린 것 같습니다. 게임이 끝날 때 쯤 되어서 시계를 봤더니 내 시간이 사라져 있는 게임입니다.책으로 따지면  page-tunner로 볼 수 있을 것 같습니다. 한번 플레이하면 끊어서 플레이 하기 싫어집니다.퍼즐 형식의 게임을 잘 못하는 편인데도 클리어 한 걸 보니 다른 분들은 더 쉽게 플레이 하실 수 있을 것 같습니다. 어느새 포털건 소리에 중독되어서 몸도 같이 마우스와 따라가는 내 자신을 발견할 수 있습니다.기계음을 싫어하는 편이라 나중에 노이로제가 걸릴 것 같긴 하지만 그래도 스토리가 좋고 컨셉도 좋습니다. 주인공인 나 자신이 하나하나 깰때마다 직접 게임속으로 들어가서 쓰담쓰담 해주고 싶은 충동이 듭니다.

추천합니다:
1. 퍼즐 게임 좋아하시는 분
2. 스토리가 어느정도 있는 게임을 좋아하시는 분
3. 이리저리 뛰어다니고 화면 전환이 빠른게 좋으신 분

비추천합니다:
1. 키보드와 마우스 동시조작을 잘 못하시는 분
2. 기계 목소리 들으면 등골부터 소름이 쭉 올라오시는 분
3. 머리를 빠르게 굴리는 것을 싫어하며 몇 번 해보고 안되면 공략을 봐야 성미가 차시는 분
Great Game
流程短些，不过结尾的那首Still Alive很惊艳，很有想象力的游戏！
Просто шедевр, любые другие слова будут излишними. Каждый, кто считает себя настоящим геймером, просто обязан пройти эту игру.

Almost literal outside the box thinking required, only "almost" because you're still inside the "box" just on the other side of it without ever crossing the room. You learn to think with portals, and start wishing you had one, or two (as in get both this and 2!)

0/5 still didn't get my cake.

Would recommend to people who don't care about cake.

10/10


the cake was good
A very interesting concept for a game and very well executed, even though its length is very short.

Dieses Spiel war und ist in seiner Einfachheit schlichtweg genial: es ist fordernd, die eigentlich mit sehr schlichten Mitteln  nur knapp erzählte Geschichte ist fesselnd, GLADOS als Charakter ist bezaubernd, amüsant und erschreckend zugleich und der Abspann womöglich der beste Spielmoment meiner Gaming-Historie. ALL TIME CLASSIC. It's hard to overstate my satisfaction.
Really makes you think.
Пожалуй лучшая головоломка
a must play game
fantastic puzzler
Good classic game

刚玩了一会时，老cs的画风，很亲切。但这不是恐怖游戏吧，感觉好吓人，莫名的bgm，诡异的AI的声音，不知道会不会突然窜出一只丧尸。。。即使玩过了好几关，但AI说话时，还是会起鸡皮疙瘩。。。
3小时一口气玩到远跳成就那里，可以肯定了，这就是部恐怖游戏。今天实在不行了，后面越玩越慌，越玩越绝望，真的能出去吗，出去后有是什么样子的世界，那不止一次看到的血色的天空。所谓的自由又是不是另一个cake?？？

Portal, despite its age, is today still a very enjoyable puzzle game that introduces innovative gameplay through the process of creating portals to proceed through levels. The puzzles increase in difficulty as you progress but I never found myself stuck for too long as all new gameplay elements are explained and the levels are designed very well. 

The story and characters, although limited, have an interesting role in the game, adding background and purpose to your mission and including humour and engaging dialogue throughout all the levels. Voice acting and soundtrack is also very well done.

Portal lasts roughly 3-4 hours for a first playthrough but keeps you challenged and entertained throughout its entire duration right up until the very end of the credits. Would highly recommend this and Portal 2 for those looking to try out a fresh, interesting type of game even if you are unfamiliar with puzzle games as it is extremely easy to pick up and enjoy.
Amazing game. No matter how many time's I'll play it, it will always make my laugh or think again about  each and every puzzle!
This is, hands down, the best two-and-a-half hour video game experience there is. Just buy it already.

(my old Portal review from dawnbreakergaming.com)

Portal to the Past

For the approximate 5 people in the world who haven’t heard about this game, on October 10th, 2007, Valve released this little game named Portal, as part of a package known as The Orange Box. Published and developed by Valve Corporation, it was released on Valve’s own digital store, Steam, and it was also available for the XBox 360 and the PlayStation 3. Originally, I only wanted the Orange Box for the game Team Fortress 2, a game I had been eagerly awaiting the release of for years, as I played the original mod for the game Quake. However, since Portal came with it, I decided to give it a shot. Once I started playing, I ended up staying up all night and completing the game. Portal is by no means a very long game, but it lasted long enough to be a very enjoyable experience without overstaying its welcome. 

Plot

Portal revolves around the player character protagonist Chell, who wakes up from stasis to warnings and instructions for the upcoming tests in what is called the Enrichment Center. Chell then proceeds through these test chambers, which get increasingly dangerous. Despite promises of counseling (and cake) from the AI known as GLaDOS, it becomes clear GLaDOS does not regard human life as very valuable. As the story progresses you obtain the use of a Portal gun, which allows you to project 2 portals on to various surfaces.  Each portal created can be used as an entrance, and after entering either one, you’ll then exit at the location of the other portal.  This allows you to travel instantaneously between them, but you also keep your momentum as you pass through them, allowing you to do a variety of physics tricks that can help you reach various locations.


Now it is hard to really go into the plot without spoiling things, so without ruining the surprise, the plot revolves around your fight for survival as you travel through the world alone. The game provides you with mostly inanimate objects and verbal abuse from the aforementioned GLaDOS.  Humans are reduced to guinea pigs as GLaDOS pits you against various rooms that force you to solve puzzles on how to reach certain locations, as well as a variety of other challenges,  such as moving objects around to hold down buttons, all while trying to stay alive.  There are many dangers that you’ll encounter, and they can be as simple as avoiding a deadly liquid, to dodging military droids that track and shoot you when moving within their view.  Somehow, through all of these fairly empty chambers, you will find the most compelling of stories. By design, you will get attached to the most unlikely of companions. 

“Somehow, through all of these fairly empty chambers, you will find the most compelling of stories.” 

Gameplay

Portal is a mix of first person shooter and puzzle-platformer, and in my opinion, it is probably one of the best games ever to mix those genres. Instead of shooting things to kill or destroy them outright, you use your Portal gun to navigate a series of test chambers by moving between locations you would not be able to reach by normal means, as well as move objects that can be the key to opening the path to exiting these chambers. Luckily you are equipped in such a way that keeps you from taking any fall damage, or else each chamber would be even more dangerous and deadlier than they already are. There is often more than one way of using your portal gun and items in your surroundings to reach your goals. In fact there are additional challenges in the game, separate from the main story line, that pit you against a time clock, or have you complete specific chambers with the least amount of portal use as possible. After the main story I wanted to play Portal so much more that I went back and played through these challenges as well.  I was surprised that I was able to complete a deceptively vast chamber with literally 2 portals. I'm even fairly certain that I completed a test chamber in the most unique of ways; using a wall that opens temporarily by placing the exit portal on it while it was open. In short, the gameplay is wonderful, with the use of tight controls, physics, and a bit of creativity, the things you can do are amazing. Being able to think through a puzzle and execute the motions required to finish the chamber results in the most satisfying feeling! 

“Being able to think through a puzzle and execute the motions required to finish the chamber results in the most satisfying feeling!”

Environments

The test chambers feature a very clean aesthetic that starts out simple, but become more complex over time. It seems clear that the chambers were designed not only to convey the situation you were in, but also to allow the player to easily gauge their portal shots to effectively navigate each puzzle presented. They have a mix of artistic style and practicality that I wish more games effectively accomplished. Various things are added to the simple world as you progress, but hidden around the corner from the sleek walls that you see are things that break up the otherwise very similar surroundings of each test chamber. As you progress, and perchance get tired of the solid colors and shapes of many locals, the game changes the surroundings, dramatically keeping you engaged in what is a fairly linear path. The aesthetic is so well liked that it has been copied in many other places, such as a map in the game Killing Floor. I personally enjoy it a lot and seek to play other games that have levels inspired by Portal. Most of the game has a non-lyrical, ambient music that is made to match the mood of the environments, and in the ending credits there is a song called “Still Alive” which many adore. The song’s execution and humor is hard to adequately describe, but I can say that it has been praised and played in various places. (source: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Still_Alive)  

More Info

Portal is a spiritual successor to the freeware game Narbacular Drop, which was a 2005 independent indie game developed by Nuclear Monkey Software. Robin Walker, one of Valve’s developers, saw the game at the DigiPen Institute of Technology annual career fair, which then lead to Gabe Newell, CEO of Valve, seeing the game and offering the entire team jobs at Valve. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal_(video_game) and  http://youtu.be/5e14kuSVDm4 )The Portal universe is actually set in the Half-Life universe, another game created by Valve. There is also an official comic called Lab Rat that connects the story of the original Portal, to its sequel, Portal 2. Portal is now also available to enjoy on OS X, Linux, and Android. The game’s popularity has lead to a wide variety of merchandise associated with Portal, such as coffee mugs and plush toys. There is also an on going internet meme relating to the phrase “the cake is a lie.” 

Performance

From my perspective of the PC version; the game runs very well, as it should on fairly modern systems due to the fact it is built on Valve’s Source Engine, which has been used in many games such as Counter Strike: Source, Left 4 Dead, and Half-Life 2.  It does not even require a gig of RAM or a multi-core processor, so even older PC’s or laptops can easily play this game. (source: http://store.steampowered.com/app/400/ ) 

Bottom Line

I love this game, and I’m certainly not alone, as many, many, many others also love it. In fact, it received critical reception, as it earned more praise than Half-Life 2: Episode Two, and Team Fortress 2, which were both included in the Orange Box. It won various awards including Game of the Year, Innovation Award, and Best Game Design at the 2008 Game Developers Choice Awards. (source: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal_(video_game) http://www.gamechoiceawards.com/archive/gdca_8th.html) 
Great story. Great humor. Great puzzles. If you like FPS with a side of puzzles and dark humor, this game is for you!

Short and fun.  Great physics and humor.  Worth playing again every year or so, and sing-along at the end.

Aperture Science;
We do what we must,
Because we can.

For the good of all of us.
Except the ones who are dead.

But there's no sense crying
Over every mistake.
You just keep on trying
Till you run out of cake.
And the science gets done,
And you make a neat gun
For the people who are
Still alive.

秋季特卖打折买的，绝对物超所值。先玩过传送门2，想看看前代剧情（另外对腹黑御姐GLaDOS念念不忘）就又买了这款，内容不是很多啦，19个房间加逃脱，大概两个多小时通关（2代大概用了11小时），许多隐藏场景等待发现，还有成就可以刷。细节做得很棒，包括血迹弹孔之类的。优化貌似稍微差一点？死亡不会自动重开，有时候会卡顿，不知道是不是我内存的问题。喜欢2代的朋友们不妨也来考考古，喜欢一代的朋友们也不要错过2代，传送门是一款伟大的作品。

Ну что сказать... Классика... Если ищете ненавязчивую, но при этом увлекательную головоломку, то Portal - Ваш выбор. Игра заставляет переосмысливать понятие пространства как такового, тем самым развивая ваше пространственное (Простите за тафтологию :3 ) воображение. 10/10.

I am happy to say I've now filled one great gap in my general knowledge by playing through Portal. I feel more in the loop now gaming wise than I've felt in a long while.

The graphics and controls are clear, simple and natural and do not distract from the puzzles that are the main content. Everything is polished and well thought out. Where the game really shines is that the puzzles are extremely well tuned for difficulty and the main elements are introduced in a simple succession. Throughout the game I never felt stuck for more than a few minutes and constanlty got to feel the thrill of finding a solutions to a puzzle.

The game is almost 10 years old now, but I am sure it would be as successful if it would be released today. A bit short, but then there is always Portal 2.

Portal is a first person puzzle game with interesting storyline, amazing music and highly soothing and relaxing environment. Although the first Portal's campaign is short and just like a tutorial for Portal 2, there is high replayability with different challenge modes. This is game that everyone must play, a true timeless gem created by Valve.

10/10 Highly recommended.
Buy Portal bundle that includes both Portal 1 and 2 and is usually 80-85% off during the sales.
